ReadWriteLock#

template<concepts::NotReference T>
class ReadWriteLock#

Owning reader/writer lock for synchronizing a single piece of data.

Owns an instance of type T, and provides synchronized protected access to it with ScopedLockGuard<T, LockType>s. write() and try_write() provide exclusive read/write access via ScopedLockGuard<T, std::unique_lock>, while read() and try_read() provide shared read-only access via ScopedLockGuard<T, std::shared_lock>`

Example: 

#include "Hyperion/Synchronization.h"
#include <array>
#include <thread>
// create a `ReadWriteLock<T>` protecting a `std::array`
auto array = ReadWriteLock(std::array<i32, 10>());
auto previous = 1_i32;
{
    // get write access and mutate all of the elements in the array
    auto write_guard = array.write();
    for(auto& i: *write_guard) {
        i = previous + previous;
        previous = i;
    }
}
// ^^^ Notice we had to scope `write_guard`'s lifetime so we could get read access below.
// Guards only release ownership when they're destroyed

// print each element, splitting each half across two separate threads.
// get read access as necessary by calling `read()`
auto thread1 = std::jthread([&array]() {
    // we can choose to only lock the array long enough to access a single
    // member/member function by using the `ReadLockGuard` as a temporary
    const auto size = array.read()->size();
    for(auto i = 0_usize; i < size / 2_usize; ++i) {
        // or we can hold onto the `ReadLockGuard` as long as we need to do our work
        auto read_guard = array.read();
        println("{}", read_guard->at(i));
    }
});
auto thread2 = std::jthread([&array]() {
    const auto size = array.read()->size();
    for(auto i = size / 2_usize; i < size; ++i) {
        println("{}", array.read()->at(i));
    }
});

Template Parameters

T – - The type of the value to be guarded/synchronized

Public Functions

ReadWriteLock() noexcept(concepts::NoexceptDefaultConstructible<T>) = default#

Constructs a default ReadWriteLock<T>

Requirements#

  • concepts::DefaultConstructible<T>: The protected T must be default constructible in order to default construct a ReadWriteLock<T>

ReadWriteLock(const ReadWriteLock &lock) = delete#

ReadWriteLock<T>s are not copyable

inline ReadWriteLock(ReadWriteLock &&lock) noexcept(concepts::NoexceptMoveConstructible<T>)#

Move constructs the given ReadWriteLock<T> from the given one.

Acquires exclusive access to the data in the given lock and moves its data into this one.

Requirements#

  • concepts::MoveConstructible<T>: The protected T must be move assignable in order to move construct a ReadWriteLock<T>

Parameters

lock – - The ReadWriteLock<T> to move

inline ReadWriteLock(const T &data) noexcept(concepts::NoexceptCopyConstructible<T>)#

Constructs a ReadWriteLock<T> with the given initial data.

Requirements#

  • concepts::CopyConstructible<T>: The protected T must be copy constructible in order to construct a ReadWriteLock<T> initialized with a copy of the given data

Parameters

data – - The data to guard

inline ReadWriteLock(T &&data) noexcept(concepts::NoexceptMoveConstructible<T>)#

Constructs a ReadWriteLock<T> with the given initial data.

Requirements#

  • concepts::MoveConstructible<T>: The protected T must be move constructible in order to construct a ReadWriteLock<T> initialized by moving data into it

Parameters

data – - The data to guard

inline auto read() const noexcept -> ReadLockGuard<T>#

Returns a ReadLockGuard<T> providing read-only access to the protected T

Returns

a ReadLockGuard<T> to the data

inline auto try_read() const noexcept -> Result<ReadLockGuard<T>>#

Attempts to gain shared read-only access to the protected T

If access is gained successfully, returns a ReadLockGuard<T> to the data, otherwise returns an error.

Returns

Ok(ReadLockGuard<T>) on success, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

inline auto write() noexcept -> WriteLockGuard<T>#

Returns a WriteLockGuard<T> providing exclusive read/write access to the protected T

Returns

a WriteLockGuard<T> the the data

inline auto try_write() noexcept -> Result<WriteLockGuard<T>>#

Attempts to gain exclusive read/write access to the protected T

If access is gained successfully, returns a WriteLockGuard<T> to the data, otherwise returns an error.

Returns

Ok(WriteLockGuard<T>) on success, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

auto operator=(const ReadWriteLock &lock) -> ReadWriteLock& = delete#

ReadWriteLock<T> is not copyable

inline auto operator=(ReadWriteLock &&lock) noexcept(concepts::NoexceptMoveAssignable<T>) -> ReadWriteLock&#

Move-assigns this ReadWriteLock<T> from the given one Acquires exclusive access to the data in the given lock and moves its data into this one.

Requirements#

  • concepts::MoveAssignable<T>: The protected T must be move assignable in order to move construct a ReadWriteLock<T>

Parameters

lock – - The ReadWriteLock<T> to move
